title.narrative: 4.1 STRENGTHEN NATIONAL POLICY FRAMEWORK

description.narrative: Strengthened national policy frameworks and systems that prevent and respond to abuse, exploitation, neglect and violence against children by 2015, which contributes to Access To Justice, Birth Registration, Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ General, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Data And Child Protection, Justice For Children, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Vulnerable children and those who survive abuse, neglect, exploitation and violence receive quality services by 2015.

related-activity.ref: 4030/A0/04/007 4: SYSTS. TO PREVENT & RESP TO VIOLENCE

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strengthened national policy frameworks and systems that prevent and respond to abuse, exploitation, neglect and violence againstchildren by 2015
% Of health facilities providing birth registration services

actual.value: 2015:Instead of addressing only health sector specific bottlenecks to birth registration, the country has been engaged into a comprehensive CRVS national assessment process. The findings and recommendations from the assessment were endorsed by the Government as a basis for full-scale reform of CRVS.

title.narrative: Children's Protection and Welfare Act implementation plan in place

baseline.value: No implementation plan exist for child Protection & Welfare Act

target.value: 2015:Child Protection & Welfare Act implementation plan is endorsed by government

actual.value: 2015:Due to decommissioning of the Children's Coordination Unit, no progress was achieved with regard to CPWA overall implementation plan, however significant progress was achieved in Justice and Police sectors. Specific Training modules for these two sectors were developed and utilized to capacitate Jus

title.narrative: Status of strategic action plan on violence

actual.value: 2015:A four day National GBV conference, which brought together all stake holders who address violence related matters, discussed and produced a set of comprehensive and sector specific actions to be incorporated in the Violence response national strategy. The strategy is expected to be finalized in earl
